Installation

PhilJS can be installed via npm, yarn, pnpm, or cargo for Rust projects. Choose your preferred package manager below.

Quick Start

The fastest way to get started is using the create-philjs CLI which sets up everything automatically:

Terminal
$npm create philjs@latest my-app
$cd my-app
$npm run dev

This will create a new PhilJS project with TypeScript support, Vite for bundling, and a basic project structure.

Using Package Managers

npm

Terminal
$npm install philjs-core philjs-router

yarn

Terminal
$yarn add philjs-core philjs-router

pnpm

Terminal
$pnpm add philjs-core philjs-router

Bun

Terminal
$bun add philjs-core philjs-router

Rust Installation

For Rust projects, PhilJS provides a Cargo extension that manages your PhilJS project:

Terminal
$cargo install cargo-philjs
$cargo philjs new my-app
$cd my-app
$cargo philjs dev
i

Rust Version

PhilJS Rust requires Rust 1.75 or later. The framework uses the latest stable features including async traits and const generics.

Available Packages

PackageDescription
philjs-coreCore reactivity system with signals, memos, and effects
philjs-routerFile-based routing with nested routes and data loading
philjs-formsForm handling with validation and server actions
philjs-ssrServer-side rendering and hydration
philjs-uiPre-built accessible UI components
philjs-devtoolsBrowser extension for debugging

Vite Configuration

If you're adding PhilJS to an existing Vite project, update your vite.config.ts:

vite.config.tstypescript
1import { defineConfig } from 'vite';
2import philjs from 'philjs-compiler/vite';
3 
4export default defineConfig({
5  plugins: [
6    philjs({
7      // Enable JSX transform
8      jsx: true,
9      // Enable SSR mode
10      ssr: false,
11      // Enable islands mode for partial hydration
12      islands: false,
13    }),
14  ],
15  esbuild: {
16    jsx: 'automatic',
17    jsxImportSource: 'philjs-core',
18  },
19});

TypeScript Configuration

Add the PhilJS JSX types to your tsconfig.json:

tsconfig.jsonjson
1{
2  "compilerOptions": {
3    "target": "ES2022",
4    "module": "ESNext",
5    "lib": ["ES2022", "DOM", "DOM.Iterable"],
6    "moduleResolution": "bundler",
7    "jsx": "react-jsx",
8    "jsxImportSource": "philjs-core",
9    "strict": true,
10    "skipLibCheck": true
11  }
12}
